lead_paragraph: The reporter, Frances Robles, has been subpoenaed to appear at a pretrial hearing for Conrado Juárez, who is accused of killing 4-year-old Anjélica Castillo in 1991.

headline.print_headline: Times Reporter Could Be Forced to Testify in ‘Baby Hope’ Murder Case
headline.main: New York Times Reporter Could Be Forced to Testify at ‘Baby Hope’ Hearing

snippet: The reporter, Frances Robles, has been subpoenaed to appear at a pretrial hearing for Conrado Juárez, who is accused of killing 4-year-old Anjélica Castillo in 1991.
abstract: Manhattan prosecutors have issued subpoena to New York Times reporter Frances Robles in attempt to force her to testify at pretrial hearing about prison interview with Conrado Juarez, accused of 1991 murder of toddler Anjelica Castillo, also known as Baby Hope; district attorney's office argues Robles' testimony is needed to prove Juarez freely confessed to crime.
